intro: Torilis stenocarpa, commonly known as narrow-fruited groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Torilis stenocarpa is an annual plant that produces small, elongated fruits that are dispersed by wind.
